description: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban and hedge fund manager Bill Ackman have reacted to Elon Musk's recent social media post. Musk, despite his immense wealth, expressed that money cannot buy happiness. Cuban agreed that wealth magnifies existing feelings, while Ackman advised Musk to focus on philanthropy and finding a long-term partner. Musk previously stated that effective philanthropy is challenging.

description: Thailand's general election saw a tight race between the progressive People's Party, populist Pheu Thai, and conservative Bhumjaithai. With no single party expected to win a majority, coalition-building is crucial for forming the next government. Voters cast ballots amidst economic concerns and nationalist sentiment, with a referendum on a new constitution also held.

title: Ex-Pak cricketer says Babar Azam may be dropped for next game
description: Babar Azam's position in Pakistan's T20 team is under scrutiny. A slow innings against the Netherlands has led to sharp criticism. Former player Basit Ali suggested Babar might be dropped for the next match. Concerns about his T20 suitability were highlighted by past Big Bash League struggles. Team management had previously indicated that reputation would not guarantee selection.

He had joined the Haryana Armed Police in 1989 and was scheduled to retire in March after completing 36 years of service. His body was handed over to his family on Sunday following a post-mortem examination.

After year of turmoil, Indian diamonds and gems set to shine in US markets
description: India and the US have agreed to an interim trade framework granting zero-duty access for diamonds and colored gemstones. This move is seen as a critical inflection point for the Indian gems and jewellery sector, aiming to reverse a significant decline in exports to the US market and restore competitiveness.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
description: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.
